meanings.definition: A shrub of the rose family with small white flowers and red berries.
meanings.sent1: The squawbushes in the garden bloomed beautifully this spring.
meanings.sent2: We picked some squawbushes to make a lovely floral arrangement.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels had a party in the squawbushes, swinging from branch to branch.
meanings.sent4: The squawbushes stood out like bright jewels in the green landscape.
meanings.sent5: The children loved playing hide-and-seek among the squawbushes.

meanings.definition: The plural form of squawbush, referring to multiple shrubs of the rose family.
meanings.sent1: The hikers admired the row of squawbushes along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The gardeners planted new squawbushes to enhance the beauty of the park.
meanings.sent3: The birds chirped happily, hopping from one squawbush to another.
meanings.sent4: The squawbushes lined up like soldiers guarding the entrance.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the squawbushes filled the air with sweetness.
